remixlab.proscene

Class InteractiveFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • remixlab.dandelion.geom.Frame
      • remixlab.dandelion.core.GenericFrame
        • remixlab.proscene.InteractiveFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Grabber, Trackable, Copyable

    public class InteractiveFrame
extends GenericFrame
    A Processing GenericFrame with a profile() instance which allows Shortcut to Method bindings high-level customization. (see all the *Binding*() methods).

    Visual representations (PShapes or arbitrary graphics procedures) may be related to an interactive-frame in two different ways:

    1. Applying the frame transformation just before the graphics code happens in papplet.draw() (refer to the GenericFrame API class documentation).
    2. Setting a visual representation directly to the frame, either by calling setShape(PShape) or addGraphicsHandler(Object, String) in papplet.setup(), and then calling Scene.drawFrames() in papplet.draw().
    When a visual representation is attached to a frame, picking can be performed in an exact manner (using the pixels of the projected visual representation themselves) provided that the GenericFrame.pickingPrecision() is set to GenericFrame.PickingPrecision.EXACT and the scene Scene.pickingBuffer() is enabled (see Scene.enablePickingBuffer()). The strategy doesn't support coloring or texturing operations to take place within the visual representation. Use another GenericFrame.pickingPrecision() if this is the case or if performance is a concern (using a picking buffer requires the geometry to be drawn twice).

    If the above conditions are met, the visual representation may be highlighted when picking takes place (see enableHighlighting()). Highlighting is enabled by default when Scene.drawFrames() is called. To implement a different highlighting strategy, disableHighlighting() and then iterate through the scene frames using code like this: 

     
 for (InteractiveFrame frame : scene.frames()) {
   fill(scene.mouseAgent().inputGrabber() == frame ? highlightedColor : normalColor);
   frame.draw();
 }
    Note that iterating through the scene frames is not as efficient as simply calling Scene.drawFrames().
    See Also:
    GenericFrame

      • setPickingPrecision

        public void setPickingPrecision(GenericFrame.PickingPrecision precision)
        Description copied from class: GenericFrame
        Sets the picking precision of the frame.

        When GenericFrame.pickingPrecision() is GenericFrame.PickingPrecision.FIXED or GenericFrame.PickingPrecision.ADAPTIVE Picking is done by checking if the pointer lies within a squared area around the frame GenericFrame.center() screen projection which size is defined by GenericFrame.setGrabsInputThreshold(float).

        When GenericFrame.pickingPrecision() is GenericFrame.PickingPrecision.EXACT, picking is done in a precise manner according to the projected pixels of the graphics related to the frame. It is meant to be implemented by generic frame derived classes and requires the scene to implement a so called picking buffer (see the proscene Scene class for a possible implementation) and the frame to implement means to attach graphics to it (see the proscene InteractiveFrame class for a possible implementation). Default implementation of this policy will behave like GenericFrame.PickingPrecision.FIXED.

        Overrides:
        setPickingPrecision in class GenericFrame
        See Also:
        GenericFrame.pickingPrecision(), GenericFrame.setGrabsInputThreshold(float)

      • checkIfGrabsInput

        public final boolean checkIfGrabsInput(float x,
                                       float y)
        An interactive-frame may be picked using 'ray-picking' with a color buffer (see Scene.pickingBuffer()). This method compares the color of the Scene.pickingBuffer() at (x,y) with id(). Returns true if both colors are the same, and false otherwise.
        Overrides:
        checkIfGrabsInput in class GenericFrame
        See Also:
        GenericFrame.setPickingPrecision(PickingPrecision)

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Same as draw(scene.pg()).
        See Also:

      • draw

        public boolean draw(PGraphics pg)
        Draw the visual representation of the frame into the given PGraphics using the current point of view (see Scene.applyWorldTransformation(PGraphics, Frame) ).

        This method is internally called by the scene to Scene.drawFrames(PGraphics) into the Scene.disablePickingBuffer() and by draw() to draw the frame into the scene main Scene.pg().

      • visit

        public void visit()
        Description copied from class: GenericFrame
        Procedure called by the scene frame traversal algorithm. Default implementation is empty, i.e., it is meant to be implemented by derived classes.
        See Also:
        AbstractScene.traverseGraph()

      • addGraphicsHandler

        public void addGraphicsHandler(Object obj,
                               String methodName)
        Attempt to add a graphics handler method to the frame. The default event handler is a method that returns void and has one single PGraphics parameter. Note that the method should only deal with geometry and that not coloring procedure may be specified within it.
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to handle the event
        methodName - the method to execute in the object handler class
        See Also:
        removeGraphicsHandler(), invokeGraphicsHandler(PGraphics)

      • removeGraphicsHandler

        public void removeGraphicsHandler()

        See Also:

        Profile.setBinding(Shortcut, String)

      • hasClickBinding

        public boolean hasClickBinding(int id,
                               int count)
        Same as return profile.hasBinding(new ClickShortcut(id, count)).
        See Also:
        Profile.hasBinding(Shortcut)

      • removeClickBinding

        public void removeClickBinding(int id,
                               int count)
        Same as profile.removeBinding(new ClickShortcut(id, count)).
        See Also:
        Profile.removeBinding(Shortcut)

      • removeClickBindings

        public void removeClickBindings()
        Same as profile.removeBindings(ClickShortcut.class).
        See Also:
        Profile.removeBindings(Class)

      • removeClickBindings

        public void removeClickBindings(int[] ids,
                                int count)
        Same as for(int i=0; i<ids.length; i++) removeClickBinding(ids[i], count).
        See Also:
        removeClickBinding(int, int)

      • profile

        public Profile profile()
        Returns the frame Profile instance.

      • setProfile

        public void setProfile(Profile p)
        Sets the frame Profile instance. Note that the Profile.grabber() object should equals this scene.
        See Also:
        setBindings(GenericP5Frame)

      • setBindings

        public void setBindings(remixlab.proscene.GenericP5Frame otherFrame)
        Same as profile.from(otherFrame.profile()).
        See Also:
        Profile.from(Profile), setProfile(Profile)

      • info

        public String info()
        Returns a description of all the bindings this frame holds.
